07:41 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
07:41 <vmassol> I think this is for you: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/All/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/1161/testReport/  
07:41 <vmassol> seems someone put a & instead of &  
07:41 <+mflorea> that's exactly what I'm fixing right now :)  
07:41 <vmassol> ok  
07:42 <+mflorea> and good morning to you too  
07:42 <vmassol> can you look at this too: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/All/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1082/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/LiveTableEditorTest/testSaveAndContinue/ ?  
07:42 <+mflorea> I will  
07:42 <vmassol> probably missing a waitfor  
07:42 <+mflorea> nop, it's something else  
07:43 <+mflorea> it waits for the save notification  
07:50 <+mflorea> hmm, it seems {{html clean=false}} doesn't escape &

09:31 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: Hi. Why don't you add your company and services here http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support#HProfessionalSupport ? :)  
09:32 <vmassol> (same question for the download page: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DownloadCode/DownloadFeedback )  
09:44 <+AndreasJonsson> vmassol:  Thanks for reminding me, I will do that.  
09:45 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rb6cfc23 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b6cfc23308622bd02ba9ad88d5b3191071b46f38 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/LiveTableViewSheet.xml : Fix webstandards validation test. - http://git.io/N6WIgA  
09:45 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r56a8607 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/56a8607ad15283f37e5d1921a89de5e64fc12793 / (3 files): XWIKI-7636: The color picker doesn't open if the list of configured colors doesn't contain only hex codes - http://git.io/IOElYA  
09:45 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r518440d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/518440d35b78e963d7066e834dbc6a3e4399decb / (2 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Bullet-proofing and unit tests. - http://git.io/X\_I5bA  
09:45 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* rdc4734c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/dc4734cc2596555d60f000c9435e571d94db3c34 / (3 files): XWIKI-7636: The color picker doesn't open if the list of configured colors doesn't contain only hex codes - http://git.io/KxiBrg  
09:45 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r9a193a6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9a193a6ea22395c73ab9393fb04a1ed592bf9fbc / (2 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Bullet-proofing and unit tests. - http://git.io/d64PVg  
09:45 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: fwiw the rules are defined here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Governance  
09:58 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <vmassol> guys I've noticed a bug when editing in wysiwyg  
10:02 <vmassol> I have vertical lines appearing  
10:02 <vmassol> see https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8m1na/editing-wysiwyg-for-wiki-home  
10:02 <vmassol> it's when editing a macro for example  
10:02 <vmassol> mflorea, sdumitriu: any idea?  
10:03 <+mflorea> Let me try to reproduce. Are you using the latest 4.0 snapshot?  
10:04 <vmassol> yes  
10:04 <vmassol> latest from maven.xwiki.org  
10:04 <+mflorea> and I suppose you're using Chrome  
10:04 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> (built yesterday evening)  
10:04 <vmassol> yes chrome  
10:05 <+mflorea> ok, let me try  
10:06 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r985fdbf https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/985fdbfbd50ba91e6aae33009f19e3d447a34943 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/wysiwyg/StandardFeaturesTest.java : Update functional test. - http://git.io/3eqDgw  
10:10 <+mflorea> vmassol: I tried with Chromium 17.0.963.79 (Developer Build 125985 Linux) and the latest 4.0 snapshot (downloaded a few minutes ago). I'm editing Main.WebHome, double click on the content to open the edit macro and everything looks fine. I don't have the vertical lines from your image..  
10:11 <+mflorea> did you do something special? besides opening the edit macro dialog?  
10:11 <vmassol> I have xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.0-20120319.190416-113  
10:11 <vmassol> no I didn't do anything special  
10:11 <vmassol> my chrome is 18.0.1025.7 dev  
10:13 <+mflorea> it's strange, the edit macro dialog should have vertical scroll bars, there is more content below "Section" parameter  
10:14 <vmassol> the scroll bar is here  
10:14 <vmassol> on lion they disappear when not used  
10:14 <+mflorea> it doesn't appear in the image  
10:14 <+mflorea> ah, ok  
10:17 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> mflorea: I'll try 4.0M1 and 3.5  
10:19 <vmassol> I'm doing a demo today and I'd rather not have those ;)  
10:29 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <vmassol> mflorea: I have the same problem with all versions of XE (I've tried 3.3.1, 3.5, 4.0M1, 4.0-SNAP. I'm going to try changing my version of chrome  
10:36 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, could be a bug in Chrome, you're using a dev version right?  
10:36 <vmassol> yes  
10:40 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r04f82ed https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/04f82ed4608fb666369312524c6beea18d81550e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/LiveTableEditSheet.xml : Fix Save & Continue in FF3.6 for the app home page edit form. - http://git.io/J2U9CA  
10:41 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r5d0aa75 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5d0aa752e03c0b251b78edfe9e217d05c71df0c9 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/LiveTableEditSheet.xml : Fix Save & Continue in FF3.6 for the app home page edit form. - http://git.io/CtsLsA  
10:43 <vmassol> mflorea: the problem is the chrome version indeed  
10:43 <+mflorea> ok, home they will fix the current problem with version 18  
10:43 <+mflorea> s/home/hope  
10:44 <vmassol> yep

11:46 <+sburjan> okay, thanks. good luck at the conference

17:30 <lucaa> has quit  
17:38 <vishnu> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <polx> has quit  
17:41 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
17:45 <vishnu> hi  
17:46 <vishnu> I am trying to work on 4383 papercut.  
17:46 <vishnu> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4383  
17:46 <@sdumitriu> Hi vishnu  
17:48 <vishnu> sdumitriu : can I see something like usecase document for xwiki? so that I can understand the flow?  
17:48 <vishnu> I mean, where and how things go in xwiki?  
17:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:49 <@sdumitriu> That's hard to answer quickly...  
17:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:50 <@sdumitriu> Did you install XWiki locally?  
17:50 <vishnu> yes, I installed stand alone version.  
17:50 <@sdumitriu> OK, then we can start with the administration part  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> Or no, let's take Toolbar / Create / Page  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> This means that you should go to the Add menu at the top of the page  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> And click on "Page"  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> The "Create Page" form should appear  
17:52 <vishnu> Yes, I did that..  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> The goal is to make the Page Name field focused by default, so when you start typing, you type in that field  
17:53 <florinciu> has quit  
17:53 <vishnu> ohhh! cool! got it! :)  
17:54 <vishnu> I see in the issue that, it talks about adding users and groups. So, I've been searching for those pages all along.  
17:55 <@sdumitriu> Now, the source for the create page form is on the filesystem, in the webapps/xwiki/templates/createinline.vm file  
17:56 <@sdumitriu> And the simplest way of fixing it is to add the autofocus="autofocus" attribute  
17:58 <polx> has quit  
17:58 <vishnu> sdumitriu : aah! got it!  
17:58 <vishnu> sdumitriu : got it! :)  
18:00 <vishnu> sdumitriu: done!  
18:00 <vishnu> I mean, one of the issue is done, I will check for others and work on them too! :) Thanks for the help sdumitriu

19:42 <lucaa> has quit  
19:48 <Qbert00> has joined #xwiki  
19:49 <Qbert00> Hi, does anyone have a clue why I can't delete any messages from my activity stream even as Admin?  
19:50 <@sdumitriu> Qbert00: Messages, or activity notifications like document edits, comments and stuff?  
19:51 <Qbert00> I mean the messages that are sent to the activity stream by users in the box  
19:51 <Qbert00> When I delete one message and refresh (or go somewhere else and come back) the deleted message is still in the stream  
19:54 <Qbert00> This did not happen when I tried the standalone version with the integrated database but now I'm running Xwiki on Separate Tomcat and Mysql 5x  
19:58 <@sdumitriu> Any errors in the log?  
20:04 <rrodriguez> has quit  
20:06 <Qbert00> actually yes, a bunch as it seems..  
20:06 <Qbert00> even on startup  
20:07 <Qbert00> first error is: java.io.IOException: Cannot create directory: /var/lib/tomcat6/data/lucene  
20:08 <Qbert00> and: ISPN000156: You are not starting all your caches at the same time.  
20:09 <Qbert00> on top of that there is error:  ERROR c.x.x.p.l.IndexUpdater         - Failed to clean index  
20:12 <@sdumitriu> Looks like you don't have write rights on some directories  
20:13 <@sdumitriu> You can either create /var/lib/tomcat6/data/ and grant write rights to the user running Tomcat  
20:13 <@sdumitriu> Or change the location where XWiki stores its data in the configuration  
20:14 <Qbert00> hmm. I'll try to add the user tomcat uses the rights first to the var/lib/tomcat6 folder(s)  
20:21 <Qbert00> Nice, so now I have only these warnings: o.i.m.DefaultCacheManager      - ISPN000156: You are not starting all your caches at the same time.  
20:21 <@sdumitriu> That's OK, you can ignore them  
20:22 <evalica> has quit  
20:23 <Qbert00> but still, does not delete the messages  
20:23 <Qbert00> :/  
20:24 <@sdumitriu> I wonder, is that a multiwiki environment?  
20:25 <Qbert00> nope, just the normal Enterprise, although I did install the Admin.Tools addon  
20:33 <@sdumitriu> Do you have Firebug installed?  
20:36 <Qbert00> Hmm, I tried this on firefox and when I press delete confirmation it gives: "{{error}}Failed to delete the message{{/error}} "  
20:36 <Qbert00> on chrome it says nothing and makes the message disappear.  
20:36 <Qbert00> Yes, I have firebug installed on firefox  
20:37 <Qbert00> although not active at the moment  
20:37 <Enygma`> has quit  
20:39 <Qbert00> Hmm, the error was just some random thing, now firefox acts as chrome - deletes the message but on refresh it's still there  
20:40 <faryshta> Do you guys think that implementing bootstraps is a good enough idea for the GSoC?  
20:42 <ssavi> has quit  
20:43 <@sdumitriu> Qbert00: Can you check on the Net tab what response is sent when you press the delete icon?  
20:48 <sdumitriu> has quit  
21:05 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
21:12 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
21:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
21:15 <sdumitriu> has quit  
21:21 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
21:22 <Qbert00> sdumitriu: so what info did you needed from the firebug ?  
21:22 <@sdumitriu> Qbert00: Sorry, I have some connection problems  
21:22 <@sdumitriu> Qbert00: Can you check on the Net tab what response is sent when you press the delete icon?  
21:22 <Qbert00> yeah, no prob.  
21:23 <Qbert00> btw, I just made a new renistall for the xwiki and the problem persisted.  
21:24 <Qbert00> This was the response http://pastebin.com/C9Qeh7Y6  
21:24 <Qbert00> ah shit, wrong paste  
21:25 <ssavi> has quit  
21:25 <Qbert00> Here's the right one: http://pastebin.com/Gv7LY6Kc  
21:29 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
21:31 <@sdumitriu> I see this in the response: {{error}}Failed to delete the message{{/error}}  
21:36 <Qbert00> Oh, hmm.  
21:41 <Qbert00> I don't see any errors in logs when I try to make the deletion  
21:42 <@sdumitriu> Anything special about the authentication, or just the default XWiki auth?  
21:43 <Qbert00> just the normal auth  
21:44 <@sdumitriu> What version of XWiki are you using?  
21:44 <@sdumitriu> 3.5?  
21:44 <Qbert00> 3.5  
21:44 <Qbert00> Everything is reinstalled and new, the only thing I did was install the default content XAR and change the password for Admin.  
21:47 <Qbert00> can this be some sort of mysql problem with the queries because I didn't have this problem when I tried the standalone version with the HSQLDB  database?
